hints.content:
In the averaging step, each point moves to the average of its current position and the point next to it. For example, the point at $A$ moves to a point halfway between $A$ and $B$.

![Averaging step](https://ka-perseus-images.s3.amazonaws.com/d08030211f68b7524325d7337fc017ef5f6235fe.png)

In the splitting step, points are added at the midpoints on each line. So we end up with this image:

![Average then split](https://ka-perseus-images.s3.amazonaws.com/ad2b7f634fead415378ec6d24a2913860117f0a7.png)
